summary: The bill, titled the Improving National Safety, Public Health, Ethics, and Clinical Trials Act (INSPECT Act), aims to establish Inspectors General for the National Institutes of Health (NIH), the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC), and the Food and Drug Administration (FDA). It modifies existing definitions in US Code to include these agencies and mandates the President to appoint individuals to these Inspector General positions within a year of the Act's enactment. The bill specifies the use of existing funds for implementation, avoiding additional appropriations.
